job_title: Customer Service Representative in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great company, good culture, and rewarding work. Oh, and did I mention, it’s remote work!
cons: The position is call center work, so the typical, unpleasant caller.

job_title: High Risk Care Manager in Camp Hill, PA
pros: Flexible work schedule. Supportive coworkers. Able to buy PTO.
cons: Management determines if you have a good experience or not. Low pay for degree. Expected travel within 3 hr radius.

job_title: Clinical Psychologist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Work from home, flexible schedule , pension
cons: Frequent changes in operation, leadership

job_title: Care Manager in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Progressive, decent benefits, remote wirk
cons: Low salary and difficult to get a raise. UPMC dictates the maximum raise and doesn’t come close to cover cost of living. Most employees work 2 jobs.

job_title: Regional Director of Operations in New York, NY
pros:
Clinical innovation encouraged
Member and provider satisfaction are paramount
cons: Overall positive experience with Community Care and the larger UPMC system

job_title: Counselor in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: able to work from home
cons: low salary for licensed professionals

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Exton, PA
pros: Even working in different departments the office is a team environment. You can see how your work directly affects other departments.
cons: The work can sometimes get monotonous. No room to move up. The position you are hired into is where you will most likely stay.

review_title: Its all about the money you save the company
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: pays well, good benefit time off, can buy an extra week of vacation, can donate blood for PTO
cons: supervisor jumps to conclusions without asking, reactive environment, pay a lot for parking, inconvenient location, rules change everyday without notice, never catch you being good

job_title: Assistant Living Care Provider in Detroit, MI
pros: Having the experience with talking young adults about their problems and solving them for future encounters.
cons: Sometimes with the adults being young, they were a bit aggressive with authority.

job_title: in DuBois, PA
pros: Abundance of support from co-workers and management, great salary and respectful environment.
cons: I had no issues while employed there.

job_title: Systems Analyst in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great opportunity for women since there are so many female senior managers.
cons: Old style company. Not good to work for people who want to telecommute.

review_title: Great place to learn and grow professionally
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Team work and professional opinions are valued
cons: The work is hard, but the environment is supportive

job_title: Care Manager in Penn Pitt, PA
pros: Supportive work environment, great coworkers, plenty of opportunities for CEU's
cons: Pay, pay, pay...not competitive

pros: Pay helping customers nice coworkers
cons: Too much work bad colleagues
